DOC.brief_summary: The aim propose study evaluate immediate effect acupuncture pain , cervical range motion electromyographic activity upper trapezius muscle patient nonspecific neck pain.Twelve patient nonspecific neck pain 12 healthy subject enrol randomize , single-blind , crossover study . Each patient receive two form treatment random order : single session traditional acupuncture sham acupuncture . To eliminate carry-over treatment effect , one-week wash-out period respect session . Surface electromyography use determine motor control upper trapezius muscle treatment . The outcome measure group neck pain numerical pain rating scale ( range : 0 [ pain ] 10 [ maximum pain ] ) , documentation pain area body chart cervical range motion . Linear regression analysis apply individual investigate association sEMG variable force ( exclude sixth step ) . The slopes regression line use measure sensitivity sEMG variable regard change force . The Shapiro-Wilk test use test normality data distribution regard RMS MDF value third sixth step step contraction . Paired sample ( Student 's t-test Wilcoxon test ) use test difference third sixth contraction step . A mixed linear model use analyze compare sEMG data sustain contraction ( five step ) pre-acupuncture ( EMG-1 ) post-acupuncture ( EMG-2 ) evaluation . These comparison demonstrate whether acupoints TE-5 LI-11 affect activity upper trapezius muscle , hypothesize . The pain ( NRS , PPT area ) cervical ROM data collect four evaluation also compare use mixed linear model . The Statistical Package Social Sciences ( SPSS , version 19.0 Windows ) employ statistical analysis , level significance set 5 % ( p < 0.05 ) .
